title: 820-00840-a
message:
Hi.

I have this board which is powering on but not showing picture. First i fixed flexgate just to make sure that it will run properly and since it's no picture issue of course no change. The laptop powers on fan spins and then just stays like that and it was not liquid damaged. Some time ago the client went to so called Apple official and they replaced the top case(keyboard housing) complete for no reason besides some keys pressing hard(probably from dust). Any ideas ?

Thanks

title: 820-00840-a
message: Did you check for USB activity and external video?

title: 820-00840-a
message: No external video and also no usb activity. Q8400 has voltage only on pin 3 and 4...

title: 820-00840-a
message:
Then do not waste time expecting internal video.
Your board doesn't boot at all.
Turned on, is not the same with working board which has some particular problem.


Disconnect trackpad and any other flex, and check again for USB activity.
Do you note any variations on VCORE in the first 10-15s?

title: 820-00840-a
message: PPBUS_G3H is 0v

title: 820-00840-a
message:
"this board which is powering on
--------------------------
PPBUS_G3H is 0v"
I don't really understand; how is that possible???

title: 820-00840-a
message:
It was at a power on state probably something went off in the meantime. I'm not trying to take your time so please don't try to make fun out of what i wrote. I understand that you encounter many different ppl on the forum, but i really appreciate the support and would appreciate even more a bit more professional response. Thank you very much as always and once i fins time to measure all voltage i'll write back.

Have a good day

title: 820-00840-a
message: Post the actual voltages you get on the board.

title: 820-00840-a
message: I have replaced U7000 and that made a difference i got 20v on D6905 PPVIN_G3H_P3V3G3H but then U6990 burned and i replaced it now also u1900 was overheating and i replaced it also short is removed. Now i'm back at 5v and a short on C3108 and C3208 which came to be a short on U3200. I removed U3200 and now i'm stuck at 5v on the U3100...

title: 820-00840-a
message: Do i need both ports working ?

title: 820-00840-a
message: SMC needs to talk with both CD3215 chips.

title: 820-00840-a
message: If i replace it from another board should be fine right?

title: 820-00840-a
message:
If you replace with good chip only.
Also MUST have the same termination; like C00, B03, etc...

title: 820-00840-a
message: yes same :) don't delay, buy today :ROFLMAO:

title: 820-00840-a
message: Staying on 5v on both ports after replacement of CD no short anywhere. Maybe i need to update firmware?

title: 820-00840-a
message: Do you get 1V1 LDO on the new chips?

title: 820-00840-a
message: Just got back to this board.  1V1 LDO no voltage. Also replaced u7000 again cause with he old one i was not even getting 5v on it

title: 820-00840-a
message: Would it make a difference if i don't have C3208 on the board cause it was shorted i had to remove it...

title: 820-00840-a
message: I know that on C1170 should be low resistance but when i inject 1v on it pulls 1amps :D

title: 820-00840-a
message:
Hi. Back on this board again.

i replaced both CD. I don't have 1v1 LDO on C3104

title: 820-00840-a
message: Did you have 1V1 LDO on one port before?

title: 820-00840-a
message: No i didn't. First the short was on one of the CD replaced it and it was stuck on 5v. Then shorted again on the other CD so i replaced both now i'm stuck at 5v no 1v1LDO on any of them

title: 820-00840-a
message:
U1900 was burnt because of U6990 failure; no other reason possible.
That means overvoltage on 3V3_G3H.
Not worth to continue the repair on this board; possibly bad SMC, as CPU too...

title: 820-00840-a
message: Thank you 2informaticos for your help  :cool:  happy Christmas
